page.title: 07Farming - Land Ownership
page.content:
The land in this area is mainly owner occupied but there is one area which contains parts of two small estates. These estates still let parts to tenant farmers but should a tenant vacate his smallholding, the landlord will takeover the land and farm it himself with the rest of his estate. The reason for this trend has come about as a result of the Security of Tenure Act.
It has been seen that when the landlord farms the land himself he roots out some of the ancient hedges to make the fields larger. At the same time the houses and buildings are allowed to fall into ruin or the properties are sold without the associtated land to people from outside the area as retirement or holiday homes.
